intro: Prunus apetala var. monticola, commonly known as the mountain cherry, is a shrub or small tree native to the mountainous regions of western North America. It is characterized by its smooth, reddish-brown bark and clusters of small, white flowers that appear in early spring. The plant produces small, round berries that are typically red when mature, containing a single seed. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open woodlands or rocky slopes. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and natural landscapes.
